A "special" no-operation decide rules that I think would be handy:

* Comme=
nt.  Sometimes I would like to put a comment in a rule sequence
and this wo=
uld be a way to do that.

* Debug Output.  Instead of editing conf/heritrix=
.properties to enable
verbose logging and then restarting the heritrix daem=
on, why not have
a no-op rule that appends to a file with details about how=
 a
particular rule sequence processed a URI (or DNS lookup).  

** by defau=
lt, it should stop emitting output after the first 100
items.  This means i=
t could safely stay in place without causing any
problems in production. 

=
** all the pertinent state (URI/DNS operand, fetch state, attributes,
 fina=
l decision, and the submodule name) that helps in tweaking a rule
sequence =
should be emitted with a timestamp.

This would work great for v1.x; I have=
 not used v2.x much yet, so I'm
not sure how this kind of thing fits into t=
he "sheet" concept.

(I would *not* try to implement this with the normal l=
ogging facility
because that would complicate usage.  Consider that people =
unfamiliar
with logging properties should be able to use it.  Also, logging=
 is
priority-oriented, so separating some output to a special file by kind
=
instead of by priority is not straight forward.
